numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I noticed a pattern.
2. Some students have parents with a higher income.
3. Students with parents with a higher income are more likely to be accepted.
4. The bottom 50% are about 3 times as likely to be accepted.
5. The acceptance likelihood increases in the top 50%.
6. The top 0.1% are 7 times more likely to be admitted.
7. Some applicants do not have a legacy boost.
8. Without a legacy boost, the top 0.1% have about the same chance to be admitted as the bottom 10% with a legacy boost.
9. I wonder whether this happens because children with wealthier parents have more money for better education.
10. I wonder whether this happens because some students drop out because of mental illness.
11. Mental illness can be more common in poorer accommodations.
12. This situation relates to me and my community.
13. I go to a school.
14. My school offers scholarships.
15. My school is welcoming regardless of how wealthy a family is.
16. I know many people who do not live like that.
17. Many students get bullied because of how much money they have.
18. Many students get bullied because of how little money they have.
19. This graph shows a bias in our community toward wealthy people.
20. Wealthy people can often afford a better education.
21. Some people think that this situation is fair.
22. I think that this situation is not fair.
23. The parents of these children likely work as long as the parents in the top 0.1%.
24. The parents of these children may work longer than the parents in the top 0.1%.
25. The top 0.1% were able to make a money-harvesting company.
26. Lower-class people may not have been able to make such a company because of bias in society.
27. To sum up, our community has a bias because of poverty status.
28. The headline is: College Admission: How do they show the bias in our community?
